definition: credit crisis/see also 次貸危機|次贷危机[ci4 dai4 wei1 ji1]

pinyin: di3 ya1 dai4 kuan3 wei1 ji1

definition: to break out of a crisis

pinyin: ci4 ji2 fang2 wu1 xin4 dai4 wei1 ji1

definition: subprime mortgage crisis/abbr. for 次級房屋信貸危機|次级房屋信贷危机[ci4 ji2 fang2 wu1 xin4 dai4 wei1 ji1]

sentences.english: Idealized research methods to solve the historiography of measurement was first crisis.
sentences.chinese: 理想化的研究方法首先解决了计量史学的危机。

sentences.english: Emerging Asia has grown by an annual average of 8% over the past three years—as fast as before the crisis.
sentences.chinese: 过去三年来以年均8%的速度增长着，和危机前一样。

sentences.english: The government has also engaged Western experts in crisis management.
sentences.chinese: 中国政府还致力于提高政府公共危机管理水平。

sentences.english: For all its troubles, it seems that the US is still the real Middle Kingdom.
sentences.chinese: 尽管危机重重，美国似乎仍是真正的“中央王国”。

sentences.english: They said all countries need to strengthen oversight and crisis management mechanisms.
sentences.chinese: 他们说所有的国家都需要加强失察和危机管理机制。

sentences.english: Anti-immigration sentiments are stronger in an economic crisis.
sentences.chinese: 在经济危机中，反移民的情绪会增长。

sentences.english: The anomalies of the political system have contributed to the governance crisis since the handover.
sentences.chinese: 畸型的政治制度造成回归后的管治危机。

sentences.english: A third crisis, pandemic influenza, lurks in the future.
sentences.chinese: 第三个危机是隐伏于未来的大流行性流感。

sentences.english: At the same time, the North is going through a murky, ill-understood succession crisis.
sentences.chinese: 同时，北方正在经历一个模糊而难以读懂的接班危机。

sentences.english: Two are beyond the direct control of the health sector.
sentences.chinese: 其中的两个危机在卫生部门的直接控制之外。

sentences.english: There is a slow drift into crisis.
sentences.chinese: 有一种渐入危机的趋势。

sentences.english: " He believes that population decline constitute a threat to national development, the initiative "every family raising three or even more children.
sentences.chinese: 他敦促每个家庭养育三四个孩子，以化解人口危机。

sentences.english: The regional crisis makes people tortured by heart blank and disorientation, and so on.
sentences.chinese: 出现信仰危机，人们普遍心灵空虚，迷失方向等等。

sentences.english: The emerging world has a big stake in the European crisis.
sentences.chinese: 欧洲危机和新兴国家利害攸关。

sentences.english: "We cannot allow a crisis in our financial system to become a crisis in confidence," he said.
sentences.chinese: 我们不能允许金融体系中的危机演变成信心危机。

sentences.english: "We cannot allow a crisis in our financial system to become a crisis in confidence," he said.
sentences.chinese: 我们不能允许金融体系中的危机演变成信心危机。

definition: variant of 動蕩|动荡[dong4 dang4]
internal trouble and outside aggression (idiom); in a mess both domestically and abroad
to face sth/to be confronted with
to break out of a crisis
